plugins.name: Design-to-JSON
plugins.description:
Design to JSON: A Developer's Bridge


Supercharge your design-to-development workflow with Design to JSON. This plugin inspects your selected Figma layers and recursively exports the entire hierarchy into a clean, structured, and developer-friendly JSON format. Stop manually transcribing design specs and start automating your UI development.


Who Is It For?

This plugin is built primarily for Frontend Developers and UI Engineers who need to translate Figma designs into pixel-perfect code. It's also a powerful tool for Design System Maintainers and anyone looking to automate asset extraction or design analysis.


Key Features:

‚Ä¢Recursive Tree Traversal: It doesn't just scan the top layer. The plugin dives deep into all nested frames, groups, and components to give you a complete hierarchical view.

‚Ä¢Absolute Coordinates for Layout: Outputs the global coordinates and dimensions (absoluteRenderBounds) for every element, which is exactly what you need for CSS positioning, eliminating guesswork with relative positions.

‚Ä¢Comprehensive Property Extraction: Captures a wide range of properties crucial for development:

oGeometry: Position, size, rotation.

oStyling: Fills, strokes, and effects with RGBA color values (0-255).

oTypography: Font family, style, size, line height, letter spacing, and alignment.

oAuto Layout: Direction, padding, and item spacing.

oComponent Info: Details about instances and their main components.

‚Ä¢Simple & Clean UI: A straightforward interface to generate and copy the JSON with a single click.


How to Use:

1.Select one or more elements on your Figma canvas.

2.Run the "Design to JSON" plugin.

3.Click the "Generate JSON" button.

4.The JSON output will appear in the text area.

5.Click "Copy to Clipboard" to grab the data and use it in your code.


Best Practices for Your Design File:

To get the most accurate and useful JSON, it's recommended to follow these design practices:

‚Ä¢Name Your Layers: Use descriptive layer names (e.g., "SubmitButton" instead of "Rectangle 128"). These names appear directly in the JSON, making it much more readable.

‚Ä¢Embrace Auto Layout: The plugin is built to understand Auto Layout. Using it for components, buttons, and layouts will provide rich data (padding, spacing, direction) that is directly translatable to Flexbox or similar CSS models.

‚Ä¢Use Components: Structuring your design with components helps maintain a clean hierarchy, which will be reflected in the JSON output. The plugin captures instance information.

‚Ä¢Avoid Unnecessary Grouping: Whenever possible, use Frames with Auto Layout instead of nested groups (Group > Group > Element). This results in a cleaner and more semantic JSON structure.


Limitations & Caveats:

‚Ä¢Mixed Styles in Text: While the plugin recursively finds the properties of individual elements, if a single text node contains multiple styles (e.g., different fonts or colors applied to different words), the Figma API provides summary data. The plugin will note this but cannot separate the mixed styles within that single element.

‚Ä¢Complex Vector Data: This plugin focuses on properties relevant for UI layout and styling. It does not export the raw path data (<path d="...">) of complex vector networks or boolean operations.

‚Ä¢API Boundaries: The plugin can only extract data that is exposed by the official Figma Plugin API.


Support the Developer

This plugin is developed and maintained with love. If you find it useful and it saves you time, you can say thanks by supporting its future development. Every bit of support is hugely appreciated!

plugins.name: Variables Management
plugins.description:
This plugin remaps variables between libraries inside the Figma variable table.


It‚Äôs useful when working with two connected libraries. If both libraries are duplicated for a new project, then the libraries remain connected to the original libraries.


This plugin can automatically remap those variable connections with a new library.


Currently it's maping the variables inside Figma's variable table only.

plugins.name: Text & Color to CSS Variables
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you generate clean, reusable CSS variables from selected Figma layers.

It supports both text styles and fill colors, and automatically converts them into:


@mixin snippets for font styles


:root CSS variables for color values (in HEX format)


Auto-detects color types like color-gray, color-blue, color-red, etc.


Prevents name duplication with numbered suffixes (e.g., --color-gray-1, --color-gray-2)


Sorts all variables in ascending order for better readability


Perfect for building design systems or exporting ready-to-use CSS from design files.
plugins.tagline: Extract text styles and fill colors from Figma layers and convert them into organized CSS variables.

Introduction

This plugin helps designers quickly toggle the "arabic" component variable on or off, enabling fast RTL layout adaptation for Arabic language support. It recursively updates selected nodes and their nested components for efficient internationalization.


Function Description

  1. Auto-detect components with "arabic" property
  2. Toggle the value between on and off
  3. Recurse through selected frames, groups, and instances
  4. Display real-time stats on successful and failed updates


How to Use

  1. Select one or more frames or components in your Figma file
  2. Launch the plugin
  3. Click ‚ÄúEnable Arabic Mode‚Äù or ‚ÄúDisable Arabic Mode‚Äù
  4. View results in the summary section


Notes

  1. Only components that already have an "arabic" variable will be updated
  2. The plugin does not create new properties ‚Äî please define them first
  3. Works best when your design system is RTL-ready

plugins.name: Move to Origin
plugins.description:
Move to Origin is a simple utility plugin that positions your selected elements so that the topmost and leftmost element sits precisely at coordinates (0,0).


Instructions

1. Select one or more elements on your Figma canvas

2. Run the "Move to Origin" plugin from the Plugins menu

3. Your selection will instantly move so the topmost-leftmost element is at (0,0)


Key features:

  1. One-click positioning to origin point (0,0)
  2. Maintains relative spacing between all selected elements
  3. Works with any number of selected objects
  4. No UI ‚Äî just select and run


Perfect for:

  1. Cleaning up artboard layouts
  2. Preparing elements for export
  3. Standardizing component positions
  4. Aligning multiple elements to a predictable starting point


Simply select the elements you want to reposition, run the plugin, and watch as your selection snaps to the origin while preserving the spatial relationships between all elements.


Save time and maintain precision in your designs with this essential positioning tool.
plugins.tagline: Instantly align your selection to (0,0) while preserving relative positions between elements.

plugins.name: Select by Style
plugins.description:
Select by Style makes it easy to find and select all elements on your page that share the same text or colour styling.


Perfect for designers who need to quickly audit styles, make bulk changes, or ensure consistency across their designs. Save time by selecting multiple elements at once instead of hunting them down individually.


What it does:

The plugin automatically scans your current page and organises all text styles and colour styles into easy-to-browse tables. Simply click on any style to instantly select all elements using that style across your page.


How to use it:

  1. Open the plugin to see all styles detected on your current page
  2. Browse the Text tab to see text styles with font details, sizes, and weights
  3. Browse the Colour tab to see colour styles with hex codes and opacity
  4. Use the search bar to quickly find specific styles by name, font, or colour
  5. Click any style row to select all elements using that style
  6. Use the Refresh button when you add new content to the page


Key features:

  1. Instant selection: Click once to select all elements with the same style
  2. Smart organisation: Separate tabs for text and colour styles with detailed information
  3. Search & filter: Quickly find styles by typing in the search box
  4. Library detection: See which styles are local vs. from external libraries
  5. Auto-refresh: Detects when you switch pages or add significant new content
  6. Live updates: Automatically updates when you change styles on selected elements


How are we doing? We're always working to make this plugin better and would genuinely appreciate hearing about your experience - and suggestions for enhancement.
plugins.tagline: Quickly select all elements using the same style

plugins.name: Frames to Auto Layout
plugins.description:
We‚Äôve all done it‚Äìselected multiple frames and tried to add auto layout to each of them, only to find that instead of adding auto layout to every frame individually as expected, Figma annoyingly groups all your selected frames and organizes them in a single auto layout.


This simple plugin provides that missing, expected functionality for Figma. With this plugin, simply select all of the frames you want to add auto layout to and run the plugin, and voila‚Äîevery frame you selected will now have auto layout added, instead of the default Figma behavior of grouping the selected frames within a new frame and organizing your selected layers in a single auto layout‚Äîso annoying!


Currently the plugin simply sets the same default auto layout properties that the standard "add auto layout" UI button and command add‚Äîhorizontal directionality and 10px padding and spacing. I may consider adding to this plugin the ability to configure custom default properties with a separate command‚Äîplease comment if such a feature would interest you.

accepted.name: Avana Vana
accepted.description:
Senior Product Designer & Full-stack Developer

Currently Design Lead at Co:Create (www.cocreate.ink)

plugins.tagline: Add auto layout to multiple frames individually, instantly.

plugins.name: Feedback Factory - Generate Feedback Screens from Spreadsheet Data
plugins.description:
The Feedback Factory is a plugin designed to streamline the creation of feedback screen variants from spreadsheet data.


Here's how to use it:


1. Upload Excel File üìÇ: Start by uploading an spreadsheet file containing feedback types and their respective content. The plugin will process this data to generate feedback variants.


2. Create Variants üé®: Add up to 10 variants by selecting a feedback type for each one. The plugin allows you to customize titles, descriptions, and button texts for each variant.


3. Generate Components üöÄ: Once your variants are set, click "Create Variants" to automatically generate the feedback components in Figma. The plugin will clone the selected frame or component and update the text elements based on the spreadsheet data.


This tool is perfect for designers looking to efficiently manage and create multiple feedback screens with consistent styling and content.
plugins.tagline: Generate feedback screens in Figma from spreadsheet data with ease and efficiency.

plugins.name: Protoboi
plugins.description:
From the makers of 'Prototype This!'... comes Protoboi.


Protoboi is a tool to save you time prototyping. It helps you perfect your interactions (bezier easing curves, durations etc.) quickly by treating them in a componentized way.


Here's how the workflow works-


1) Use our other plugin 'Prototype This!' to wire up your prototype fast.

2) Make an interaction in Figma, and get all the animation properties just how you want it.

3) Open Protoboi & bulk-apply these animation parts, like custom bezier easing curves.


It's in beta, but mostly works. Feedback appreciated (comments or drop messages on livechat). :-)
plugins.tagline: Make prototypes fast w/ Protoboi! Bulk-apply animation properties to your interactions in seconds.

plugins.name: Auto Layout Remover
plugins.description:
Auto Layout Remover helps you quickly clean up messy Figma files and make them easier to edit or prototype.


When to use it:

  1. You want to redesign freely. If your design is full of auto layouts and deeply nested frames, and you just want to move things around without dealing with layout constraints ‚Äî this plugin flattens everything so you can edit with ease.
  2. You‚Äôre building an interactive prototype. Auto layouts often create layers and nesting that block or overlap each other. This plugin helps you clean the structure fast ‚Äî so you can bring the right blocks to the top and avoid layout issues.


What it does:

  1. Turns off all auto layouts, keeping objects in place
  2. Ungroups frames and groups without visible styles (no fill, no stroke, or hidden)
  3. Deletes hidden layers and empty frames
  4. Leaves instances and styled frames untouched
  5. Makes your file flat, clean, and easy to work with
plugins.tagline: Remove all auto layouts, empty frames, and groups in one click.

plugins.name: Text Auto Fill
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin User Guide for Beginners


What It Does

This Figma plugin lets you update text and hide layers in selected frames or instances. It‚Äôs easy to use with a text-based configuration for both specific and global changes.


How to Use It

  1. Select a Frame or Instance: In Figma, click a frame or instance to edit.
  2. Open the Plugin: Run the plugin from Figma‚Äôs menu (Plugins > Your Plugin Name).
  3. Enter Configuration: In the plugin window, type instructions to change text or hide layers (see examples below).
  4. Click Run: The plugin applies your changes instantly.


Configuration Examples

‚Ä¢ Change Specific Text: To update text in a layer named title inside a frame named block, type:

block.title: Hello World

This sets the title layer‚Äôs text to "Hello World".


‚Ä¢ Change Text Globally: To update all layers named text in any frame, type:

text: Welcome

This changes every text layer‚Äôs text to "Welcome".


‚Ä¢ Hide a Specific Layer: To hide a layer named subtitle in the block frame, type:

//block.subtitle

This hides the subtitle layer.


‚Ä¢ Hide a Layer Globally: To hide all layers named icon, type:

//icon

This hides every icon layer.


‚Ä¢ Rename a Frame: To rename a frame named block, type:

$Title block: New Frame Name

This renames the frame to "New Frame Name".


‚Ä¢ Combine Actions: Mix specific and global changes, like:

block.title: Welcome
text: Hello
//block.subtitle
//icon

This updates block.title to "Welcome", all text layers to "Hello", hides block.subtitle, and hides all icon layers.


Tips

  1. Write one instruction per line.
  2. Layer names must match exactly (case-sensitive).
  3. Select at least one frame or instance, or you‚Äôll get an error.
plugins.tagline: Automatically update text in frames with key-value data

plugins.name: Fieldnotes
plugins.description:
Fieldnotes transforms in-person workshop sticky notes into digital boards.


Simply take photos of your sticky notes using your phone (you just have to scan a QR code to sync) or upload images directly to the plugin. Your physical sticky notes are instantly recreated in your board, preserving the texts, colors, position, and all your ideas :)


Fieldnotes combines several AI recognition technologies to boost accuracy and to detect even messy handwriting across multiple languages.

Pro users gain access to powerful AI-enhanced features including text improvement, grammar correction, and automatic workshop summaries.


Transform raw workshop notes into polished, actionable content and generate comprehensive takeaways to share with stakeholders, a dream follow-up!


If you want to learn more about the plugin or simply because you are passionate about Product or collaboration, feel free to reach out
plugins.tagline: Fieldnotes transforms pictures of sticky notes into stickies ‚Äî ready to share, without the hassle

plugins.name: i18n JSON exporter
plugins.description:
Escape the time-consuming manual localization work and costly third-party tools with their cumbersome plugins. Leverage the power of Figma variables for efficient i18n.


Simply use your Design System or a central library file to create i18n keys, and then effortlessly export them for development with this plugin.


Step 1

Setup your Figma variables. Create a collection, add a columns (modes) for each language you wish to localize.


Not a step

Use those variables to replace your labels, input placeholders and more. Then use the "Appearance > Apply variable mode" to switch between languages (modes). I suggest having an "ID" mode with the i18n keys, like $general.table.label_lastModified.


Step 2

Run this plugin, select a collection and modes desired, then click "Export JSON file".


Note

This plugin uses the variable group path to create a hierarchical structure in the exported JSON. For example, a variable named general / table / label_lastModified would be exported as:


{
"general": {
"table": {
"label_lastModified": "Last modified"
}
}
}


Future features

Leave comments to vote on the following features I planned and what features you would like to see on this plugin.

  1. Github Merge Request integration
  2. Support to different JSON formats
  3. Transformation capabilities
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly export your Figma i18n variables to a React-compatible JSON format
